medical_history.chief_complaint: Fever for two weeks, diarrhea for five days, poor feeding, and restlessness.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Fever started two weeks prior, diarrhea for five days. The patient had a history of recurrent fever of unknown origin and multiple episodes of oral candidiasis, controlled by Nystatin. The patient was hospitalized three times for fever workup, with persistent symptoms despite treatment with vancomycin, meropenem, voriconazole, and G-CSF.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Recurrent fever of unknown origin, multiple episodes of oral candidiasis, and history of urinary tract infection.
medical_history.family_history: Family history was non-contributory; the patientâ€™s 8-year-old brother was healthy.
